== Introduction ==

'''This distro is inactive as of January 2020.'''

Kiwi Linux is an Ubuntu derivative tailored for Romanian and Hungarian users. Kiwi is a modified  Ubuntu live CD for the i386 architecture. It includes Romanian and Hungarian localization, multimedia codecs, encrypted DVD support, Flash and Java plugins for Firefox, PPPoE GUI for accessing local internet services.
Kiwi was started by an Ubuntu core developer, Jani Monoses, with the support of Startx SRL. Contributors include Simona Muntean, Cosmin SÄƒveanu, Gergely Imre, Adi Roiban and Mihai Brehar, who provided feedback, testing, artwork and hosting.
